# GitHub Repository Setup Guide

This directory contains templates and configuration files for your GitHub repository.

## Files in this directory

- `ISSUE_TEMPLATE/` - Templates for bug reports and feature requests
- `pull_request_template.md` - Template for pull requests
- `TOPICS.md` - Suggested GitHub topics for discoverability

## Repository Description

Use this description for your GitHub repository:

```
MCP server for Bugzilla - Connect AI applications to Bugzilla bug tracking systems. Query bugs, search, and add comments securely.
```

## Initial Repository Setup Checklist

- [ ] Create repository with name `bugzilla-mcp`
- [ ] Add the repository description above
- [ ] Add topics from `TOPICS.md`
- [ ] Set repository visibility (Public/Private)
- [ ] Add LICENSE file (Apache 2.0)
- [ ] Push initial code
- [ ] Enable Issues and Pull Requests
- [ ] Add repository to `.gitignore` if needed (for local configs)

## Badges to Add (Optional)

You can add these badges to your README.md:

```markdown
![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-Apache%202.0-blue.svg)
![Python](https://img.shields.io/badge/python-3.13+-blue.svg)
![FastMCP](https://img.shields.io/badge/fastmcp-2.12.5-green.svg)
```

## Additional GitHub Features to Enable

- [ ] GitHub Discussions (for Q&A)
- [ ] GitHub Actions (for CI/CD - optional)
- [ ] Dependabot (for dependency updates)
- [ ] Code scanning (if applicable)
